issue.title: quote special boolean characters when writing

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-text
repository.description: Uber-project for (some) standard Jackson textual format backends: csv, properties, yaml (xml to be added in future)

issue.body:
"y" is a boolean (https://yaml.org/type/bool.html) and should be quoted
when written, just like all the other special boolean characters

rename.to: Quote 'y'/'Y'/'n'/'N' as names too (to avoid problems with Boolean keys)

issue.title: Allow configuring the way "must quote" is determined for property names, String values

labels.name: yaml
labels.description: Issue related to YAML format backend

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-text
repository.description: Uber-project for (some) standard Jackson textual format backends: csv, properties, yaml (xml to be added in future)

issue.body:
(note: inspired by #226 and #68 before that)

Since there are different preferences on quoting various keys, String values, it may not be possible to find perfect set that works for everyone. So let's allow configuring of the set; `YAMLMapper.builder()` should make it possible.

issue.title: Default YAML mapper quotes "y" as a key

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-text
repository.description: Uber-project for (some) standard Jackson textual format backends: csv, properties, yaml (xml to be added in future)

issue.body:
Hi, after upgrading from the `2.11.4` version of the library to the `2.12.x` line I've noticed that a default YAML mapper...
```java
ObjectMapper mapper = new ObjectMapper(new YAMLFactory());
```
...is quoting the `y` character when found as a key, whereas other single character keys (or longer string keys for that matter) are not being quoted. For example, the code...
```java
ObjectMapper defaultMapper = new ObjectMapper(new YAMLFactory());

Map<String, Integer> map = new HashMap<>();
map.put("x", 1);
map.put("y", 2);
map.put("z", 3);
defaultMapper.writeValueAsString(map);
```
...generates the YAML...
```yml
---
x: 1
"y": 2
z: 3
```
...whereas using `2.11.4` it generates:
```yml
---
x: 1
y: 2
z: 3
```

What is the reason behind such new behavior? Thanks.

(I've uploaded a sample repo (https://github.com/tcrespog/jackson-yml-test) with a simple test that reproduces the aforementioned behavior)
